text: The Prevention of Damage by Pests Act 1949 is legislation[*http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Geo6/12-13-14/55/contents ]Prevention of Damage by Pests Act 1949 on legislation.gov.uk in the United Kingdom, that creates a duty on local authorities to control mice and rats.Mammals as Pests, edited by Rory Putman, Mammal Society, p22 The legislation grants powers to local authorities to compel land owners and/or occupiers to take action to keep land free from rats and mice. Prevention of Damage by Pests Act 1949 section 4 on legislation.go.uk ==References== *http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Geo6/12-13-14/55/section/4 Category:Rodents and humans Category:United Kingdom Acts of Parliament 1949
title: Prevention of Damage by Pests Act 1949
